content: All of what you say…so true. What’s worse is that wireframes are often used as a design tool by people who lack the vocabulary, skill, and patience do real architecture, design, and specification, but still want to be the “mouthpiece” for the product and get their ideas out first. The blessing and the curse of a wireframe are that it’s so easy to produce; when a wireframe authoring tool is in the hands of the untrained, it can easily derail a project for months, forcing the development team to vet the wireframe instead of doing the real design.
